intro: Eranthemum breviflos, commonly known as the dwarf eranthemum, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically produces clusters of bright red or orange flowers that bloom during the summer months. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in a fine layer of hair, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Eranthemum breviflos is often cultivated as a garden plant due to its ability to thrive in partial shade and its resilience to various soil conditions.
